meanings.definition: To make something excessively intellectual or academic.
meanings.sent1: She overintellectualized the simple story, turning it into a confusing academic essay.
meanings.sent2: He always overintellectualized every conversation, making it hard for others to follow.
meanings.sent3: The children overintellectualized their game of tag, adding complicated rules that no one understood.
meanings.sent4: Her attempt to overintellectualize the basic math problem only made it more confusing for herself.
meanings.sent5: The teacher warned against overintellectualizing the art project, reminding the students to keep it simple and fun.

meanings.definition: Characterized by an excessive focus on intellectual pursuits.
meanings.sent1: The overintellectualized discussion left many feeling excluded and bored.
meanings.sent2: His overintellectualized approach to life often made him seem out of touch with reality.
meanings.sent3: The overintellectualized book club meeting turned into a debate on obscure literary theories.
meanings.sent4: Her overintellectualized artwork was admired by some but misunderstood by many.
meanings.sent5: The overintellectualized lecture went over the heads of most of the audience, who just wanted simple explanations.

meanings.definition: To analyze or interpret something in a overly complex or intellectual manner.
meanings.sent1: He tends to overintellectualize every movie he watches, missing the simple enjoyment of the story.
meanings.sent2: She overintellectualized the poem, dissecting each line for hidden meanings.
meanings.sent3: The detective overintellectualized the case, creating elaborate theories that led nowhere.
meanings.sent4: Their attempt to overintellectualize the team strategy only confused the players.
meanings.sent5: The scientist warned against overintellectualizing the data, emphasizing the need for clear and practical analysis.
